SUBJECT: CLO Healthcare & Life Sciences Exchange w/ Abbvie, Advocate Health, AstraZeneca, Bristol Myers Squibb, NY Presbyterian, Zoetis etc.
CONTENT: Hi Matt,   I came across First Advantage while researching solutions for the L&D / HR leaders I am bringing together for our upcoming Chief Learning Officer Healthcare & Life Sciences Exchange. A few of our CLO's also mentioned First Advantage as a valued L&D partner so I thought it was relevant to reach out. We have a group of approx. 60+ L&D decision makers from F-100+ Healthcare & Life Sciences organizations coming together this May 3-5 in Boston, MA. (Abbvie, Advocate Health, AstraZeneca, Biogen, Bristol Myers Squibb, Hackensack Meridian Health, HonorHealth, Memorial Sloan Kettering, Multicare, NY Presbyterian, Parkview Health, Sutter Health, Phillips Health, Vertex Pharmaceuticals, Zoetis & many more) who are looking to take 1:1 business meetings with best in breed HR technology and background screening providers for their top active projects over the next 6-12 months.   First Advantage's capabilities seem to align well as we're also working closely with HSI, ShiftHR and others however I wanted to hop on a quick call to learn more. Would you be open to setting up a call to discuss?   Here‚Äôs my Calendly if it makes sense to set up a time: https://calendly.com/abraham-freedberg-iqpc/30min   Best,  Abe   Abraham Freedberg

Thank you, Aga. Could you share any details on your global annual spend for 2024, 2025, and your projections for 2026? For reference, the RFP from four years ago indicated an anticipated background order volume of 15,516 from Nokia, while this current RFP lists 1,675. This is only 11% of the 2021 figure and is the basis for this inquiry.   As a result, the estimated annual contract value (ACV) has decreased from $1.5M-$2.0M USD to approximately $200K-$250K USD in this RFP.   I‚Äôm asking because the ACV affects our ability to negotiate terms, and we want to ensure our pricing tier aligns while keeping our operations team informed of potential changes.

The global volume is low for a brand like Nokia even with a planned correction. I am hoping to clarify to inform our response.  Thank you!

Hi Kelly - It was GREAT to meet DJ and Shannon yesterday.¬† We had a nice discussion and I hope we can continue dialogue leading into 2027 to help Northwestern with brand protection.¬†An example of how we hope to bring value to NW in the coming year: A common practice with other Fortune 100/500 FinBiz companies is to set up a web based portal, where NW sets the screening package (ID, Crim, etc.) and the Advisor Offices sign in / pay for the background checks on each employee. Now NW Corporate has a dashboard view (no PII) of what offices have screened to your requirements reducing brand risk.  Our annual conference is in Florida in April - a good opportunity for you, DJ or Shannon to learn from us and other clients.¬† https://offers.fadv.com/collaborate2026/¬†  Thank you again - Matt Edwards

Best wishes in 2026!

SUBJECT: Introducing Myself
CONTENT: Hi Matt. I‚Äôve been helping people find the right franchise for 20 years. There‚Äôs a new trend in franchising allowing you to be either a fully absentee or semi absentee manager. CONVERSATION TITLE: GLG Paid Consultation (499$ per hour) - Hiring, Background Checks & Regulatory Compliance Services
SUBJECT: GLG Paid Consultation (499$ per hour) - Hiring, Background Checks & Regulatory Compliance Services
CONTENT: Hi Matt,  I was hoping you could help out here - I‚Äôd like to connect with you about a quick, paid phone consultation through GLG. I'm currently working on behalf of a client that is looking to speak with experts who have experience with the topic "Hiring, Background Checks & Regulatory Compliance Services".  * One of our clients, a project team at a professional services firm, would like to speak with professionals who have experience providing background checks, drug and alcohol testing, FMCSA compliance, DOT driver checks, and other related services.  Your expertise on this topic is extremely valuable to our client. It would be really appreciative if you take some time off your plate to review these screening questions.   Given your experience in this field, I thought you might be a great resource for my client. The compensation for this engagement is $499/hr or an hourly consulting rate of your choosing for a 30-60 minute phone call with our client.¬†   Please let me know if you'd be able to lend your expertise! I'm happy to hop on a call to explain more about GLG and go through some project details, or I can send them over via email if that's a better fit for your schedule.   Feel free to set up a time in my calendar to have a 5-10 minute screening call if that is easiest: https://calendly.com/cmathur-glgroup. Please note the latest date to set in my calendar for this project is 3/7. If you are interested in speaking at a later date, please message me.   Thanks for your time & looking forward to speaking soon!  Charu Mathur | GLG +1 (737) 231-2620 You can find out more about GLG‚Äôs Compliance Framework here:  https://glginsights.com/compliance/

SUBJECT: First Advantage acquires Sterling: Background screening industry changed forever
CONTENT: Hi Aimee, I hope you're having a great week! I'm Matt from snowy Raleigh NC?? It's nice that we share connections with Matt Levin and the Idea Citizen group.   Big news - First Advantage (NASDAQ: FA) and Sterling have joined forces, similar to VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, making us the leading force in our space. We offer technology & people solutions to streamline hiring processes, save costs, and improve brand risk management globally.  For example, we invest more in tech innovation than the fourth largest player in our space earns annually - including our one of a kind Data Analytics platform our clients use to optimize the global program through real time data  I would love to schedule a chat to learn more about your global TA/recruiting needs and current pain points.  Best, Matt

SUBJECT: Matt Edwards / First Advantage - background screening leader
CONTENT: Hi Lane, I hope this note finds you doing well.¬† Wanted to share a note I am sending to Mansi Patel - who I last inquired about SCI's background screening program in 2019.¬† Mansi said you were not looking to make any changes back then, but I wanted to reach out again.¬† Do you have any thoughts on your background screening program?¬† ¬†We would love to chat about pain points and if/how we can improve them. To Mansi: "It has been quite some time since your Jan 2019 response below to my inquiry about background screening services.  A lot has changed in our industry since then including First Advantage announcing the acquisition of our largest competitor, Sterling in the spring.    We would like to discuss how we can create a proactive, standardized, data driven and always optimized background screening program for SCI. We have leading technology and a staff of Customer Success experts that would be assigned to your account.  Three quick items: 1.	As mentioned, we announced the acquisition of Sterling earlier this year and anticipate it to be complete in 4Q. ‚Ä¢	We will soon be the largest provider in our space by a wide margin with the ability to spend more on technology innovation / customer service than most of our competitors will net annually. 2.	We have a data analytics tool ‚Äì Insight Advantage ‚Äì that gives you and your dedicated Customer Success Director(s) access to real time data so we can PROACTIVELY manage the balance of spend, turnaround time, and risk management. 3.	We are offering an incentive for 1Q‚Äô25: Sign up with First Advantage in 2024 and receive 50% off background screening in Q1‚Äô25  Please consider a 30-minute non-binding discussion to talk about how we can improve your value, turnaround time and customer support."  Best wishes!¬† Matt Edwards / matt.edwards@fadv.com / +1 330 819 2604

SUBJECT: Coleman | Paid Invitation to Consult
CONTENT: Hi Matt,  I hope are doing well! I wanted to follow-up from my message from Thursday to see if you would be interested in a paid phone consultation.   My firm, Coleman Research (colemanrg.com [http://colemanrg.com/]), connects our clients in the financial services space to experts such as yourself to gain insight into the industries that they are researching.  One of our clients, an investment management firm, is researching the credit reporting and data analytics industry and would like to speak with experts who understand the space, to discuss current trends, the competitive landscape, end market dynamics, and the future outlook of the industry.  This is a high-priority project! Nothing confidential or non-public information will be discussed, and my client has agreed to not ask you to share such information.  The consultation would only be 60 minutes and there is no additional preparation work required ‚Äì our client simply seeks your opinion and expert knowledge in relation to public information only.  If interested, please provide email address for more information and custom registration link.  [PLEASE DECLINE MESSAGE IF YOU ARE NOT INTERESTED]  Looking forward to your response,  Ashley Rubin arubin@colemanrg.com Client Associate at Coleman Research

SUBJECT: Matt Edwards / First Advantage - Global Background Screening leader
CONTENT: Hi Sam, I hope you are doing well.  Quick note: I went to Lowe‚Äôs & Home Depot last night (First Advantage clients btw :) )‚Äì and couldn‚Äôt believe there was Christmas decorations up already!  SO‚Ä¶ it got me to thinking that now is a good time to plan for an improved background screening process in 2025 & beyond!   Before you know it, 2025 will be here and the battle for talent will be tougher than ever. SUBJECT: First Advantage: The Global Background Screening Leader
CONTENT: Hi Torrey, I hope this note finds you well.¬†¬†Matt Edwards from First Advantage here.  Following up on outreach made by your team who asked to learn a bit more about First Advantage via our website.  A quick note to make you aware of significant change within background screening industry leaders. First Advantage is growing and thriving due to a tremendous shift in the background screening landscape.  Background screening industry YTD '24 snapshot: February: A major background screening company reversed being publicly held after only 27 months (+ layoffs & moving support to 3rd party) March:  https://investors.fadv.com/news-releases/news-release-details/first-advantage-acquire-sterling-check-corp-22-billion-cash-and¬† April: A background screening provider in the Bay area announced layoffs that affected 32% of the company.  These are the top companies in the industry ...and as you can see... one of them is not like the others.  Many clients and former employees of your current provider are joining First Advantage. This trend highlights a broader industry movement, and we think it is crucial for Omnicom to stay ahead of potential risks. Given this change in our industry, my CRO Kari Marquis, has asked me to reach out because your brand cannot afford unforeseen risk and we are here to help.  In fact, Kari has given me the ability to offer a meaningful incentive specifically to Omnicom, to offset any change management that may be required by making a change.  Our contracts are not exclusive nor have long terms.  We earn trust, not contract it.  Over 1/2 of the Fortune 100 rely on us for their screening needs, underscoring our commitment to excellence. Let's explore how our innovative solutions can benefit Nvidia and create a standardized, data-driven, and always-optimized global background screening program. We have leading technology, and a staff of Customer Success experts that would be assigned to your account around the globe. Please consider an informational demonstration/discussion with your team. https://fadv.com/timetoswitch/¬†  Thank you for considering us.  Have a great upcoming weekend!

Then wanted to raise my kids in Akron when Abby was 1, so started a m&a business here - did a few physician deals that led me to Akron General.  Started an innovations group within AG trying to monetize IP outside of the Akron market. Mainly focused on teaching other health systems how to build a H&W Centers (like the one in Green). The Cleveland Clinic recently took over AG and didn't like that I'm employed and own the sw - and really isn't interested enough in any of this (they like sick people) so I'm starting a company to consult on buildings and run the software business. As all this was happening - we decided new school & a fresh start had to happen now or too hard to pull high schoolers out of school. SOO...we just decided to go for it. Mom is moving to Dallas ironically to be near my twin (full head of hair) brother who has twin 2-year old boys! Dad & Cheryl are ok - not great. SUBJECT: Matt Edwards | Introduction
CONTENT: Hi Amy, I hope this note finds you well and ready for a great 4th of July.  My name is Matt Edwards - a new North Carolinian! I have recently moved to Wake Forest with my wife and two daughters and am looking for a professional home after leaving Akron, Ohio and my job at  Cleveland Clinic Akron General.   Today... I am taking a chance to reach out to you and hope this does not come across as too forward.  As someone that has been associated with UNC through lifelong family friends -and- someone that has sold health & wellness IP nationally to other health systems, the UNC brand of care is what I am hoping to associate myself with.  With Duke Health pushing into Wake County and all the other competitive pressures within healthcare, I am hoping that you would consider an introductory phone call (or coffee) so that if an opportunity arises, you would at least know who I am and how I can help the UNC Health Care. To date, I have not been able to gain an introduction within the UNC health system.  "Why UNC" was further driven home to me after recently interviewing with over 25 people within Duke Health for an AVP position within their Network Services Group.  As of last Friday, we could not come to an agreement but I learned a lot about Duke and further reinforced what I am hoping to find in a new home.  My passion is "doing good" through my business development efforts and health care to be where I want to spend my career.  I proudly represented a health system in Akron, Ohio and understand local, regional and national opportunities to generate revenue.  The UNC brand of care would be an ideal brand for the lapel pin on my suit!  Would you please consider an introduction?   Thank you, Matt Edwards www.thinkmattedwards.com 330-819-2604

That Harvard article is exactly why we built SimpleCare - to be in between telemedicine and on site care. Wrapping a care team for chronic or generally well people with disease specialists (if needed) that include exercise specialists and nutritions as part of every team. This was ‚Äúwhite labelable‚Äù so that the care provider could gain brand equity through daily care and oversight - while connecting to patients daily. Tracking trends, creating accountability and earning a relationship in this consumer driven heath care world. I moved to Raleigh NC and had to pause the model - but - am as passionate as ever and would love to talk about how to tie virtual care to brick and mortar to earn loyally, improve health and reduce risk for consumer/patient, provider and payor.  Hope all is well!  Would love to talk about how to create differentiation in markets for providers that is message based remote care that hands off to telemedicine and/or on site visits.

Hi Grant -   I hope this note finds you well. I am reaching out after meeting with you back in September 2015 in your offices about a potential Health & Wellness Center model.  I can't believe how time flies!  Since we met, I have left Akron General - after it was acquired by the Cleveland Clinic and have moved to Raleigh, NC with my family.  I am now consulting with the former CEO of Akron General, Dr. Tim Stover on H&W Centers and integrating a proprietary software platform I have created to help health systems connect to consumers on a daily basis for lifestyle management (simplecarehealth.com).   Between properly positioned (and operated) H&W Center buildings and this software, we are seeing a way to differentiate health system brands with employers, payers and consumers to earn loyalty and connect with consumers for lifestyle needs versus episodic / reactive care. I really enjoyed my time with you and learning more about Lutheran Medical Center / SCL and was hoping to see where things stand today and IF you think there may be an opportunity for us to revisit our past discussions.    I hope all is well and hope to talk to you soon.  Have a great week!  Thank you,  Matt Edwards  thinkhws.com  330.819.2604 m

I am now consulting with the former CEO of Akron General, Dr. Tim Stover on H&W Centers and integrating a proprietary software platform I have created to help health systems connect to consumers on a daily basis for lifestyle management (simplecarehealth.com). Between properly positioned (and operated) H&W Center buildings and this software, we are seeing a way to differentiate health system brands with employers, payers and consumers to earn loyalty and connect with consumers for lifestyle needs versus episodic / reactive care. I really enjoyed my time with you and Debbie and CaroMont and was hoping to see where things stand today and IF you think there may be an opportunity for us to revisit our past discussions.   Dr. Stover and I are hoping to make an impact in as many communities as possible.  I would love to make the short drive west to come and visit if you had any time.  I hope all is well for you and Debbie - I hope to talk to you soon.   Have a great week!  Thank you,  Matt Edwards  thinkhws.com  330.819.2604 m

SUBJECT: M Edwards Introduction
CONTENT: Hi Heather,   I hope this note finds you well.  My name is Matt Edwards - an Ohioan that has finally come to my senses and moved my family to the blue skies of North Carolina!   I see that you work at VCA in operations in the Raleigh area - and am hoping for a brief introduction to VCA. The purpose for this note is to learn more about VCA and how you handle end of life care for your veterinarian locations. I have a colleague named Paul Hummel III who owns Hummel Funeral Homes in Akron, Ohio. This 120 year-old / 4th generation business added Hummel Pet Services eleven years ago. Paul founded this business with the belief that there is a significant need for service and care during the loss of beloved family members and provides similar services for pets as he does in his traditional business. I have been so impressed by Hummel's service after recently having to say good bye to two 14+ year old pets, that I am interested in helping to improve care in as many markets as possible. We are actively taking Hummel's model of care out nationally and are interested in learning more about VCA's brand and view of after life services. I am hoping that you would be willing to take a few minutes to discuss VCA as we are attempting to learn as much as we can about the needs in other markets (Raleigh/Durham as a starting point) and are seeking partnering opportunities.  Please let me know if we can chat for a few minutes at your convenience.   Thank you in advance for your consideration -  Have a great 4th!  Matt Edwards edwardsmatt@yahoo.com 330-819-2604 m

Thank you Terry! I hope all is well. Just returned from a long stay at the beach with all my college buddies and our kids... not a better way to spend a Bday.  All is well here in NC - I sure hope all is well with you.  Have a great 4th!  Best wishes!

CONTENT: Thought you might be interested on this course for you or your IT team.  The design of your clinical databases can determine how well or bad your system will perform, can allow or obstruct interoperability, and can simplify or complicate maintenance.  If you are a system architect, software developer, DBA or tech leaded, interested in learning EHR data storage and usage requirements, standards and good practices that can improve your DB designs, and available technologies, this course is for you.

Hi Greg,  I hope this note finds you well.  It has been a long time since your visit to Akron, OH.  As you may or may not know, the Cleveland Clinic has closed the H&W Innovations Consultancy and are not going to be pursuing that business any longer.  As a result, I have moved my family to Raleigh, NC and am actively pursuing my next career opportunity.  Dr. Stover and I intend on continuing our H&W consulting work but I am also considering looking for something more formal.   I would be interested to discuss if/how I may be able to help Mortenson in the health care space.  If appropriate, I have created  http://www.thinkmattedwards.com and would be pleased to talk to you or any of your colleagues about how I could further influence the success you are already earning.    Also - I really enjoyed working with Rachel Bartling - she was fantastic.  Thank you for your consideration.  Best wishes -  Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m
Please pass along to HR or the Innovations group if appropriate.    http://www.thinkmattedwards.com

Hi Neil -  Just touching base quickly to let you know that the Cleveland Clinic has closed my Innovations division and I will officially be in the Raleigh market full time next week.  Simply, they do not believe in Wellness.  The consulting model that we created in Akron - bringing our IP to other health systems in the health & wellness space - has produced significant revenue and helped many people in multiple markets.  We have multiple revenue sources through consulting revenue, developer partnerships resulting in fee sharing, long term royalties and as you know have added software licenses to the offering.   I am actively looking for my next opportunity to innovate at a health system and can not think of a better brand in my "new home market" than Rex Healthcare.  Representing a health care brand while trying to "do good" every day is very meaningful to me.  Would you consider introducing me to your colleagues within the Rex Health system?  I have reached out to Anita Watkins in the past but never heard any response.  I would also welcome further discussion around a pilot/partnership opportunity on the software and how I could duplicate the consultancy at Rex to add value to the overall Wellness service line.  I understand you are very busy but being new to a market and in transition, I thought I would reach out to explore if/how I can bring value to Rex.  Thank you for your consideration - I hope to see you soon now that I will be enjoying the Carolina blue skies full time.  Kind regards, Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m
So sorry your family needed our services but glad it was a good experience! Just let me know when you're ready to get together. Best! Neil

Hi Neil - I hope all is well.  My name is Matt Edwards - I work with Doug Ribley in Akron and you may or may not recall that we have met a few times at MFA.  I am reaching out to see if you are planning on attending this year in Orlando with the hope that we can grab a cup of coffee if you have time.  I have spent a few years building a software platform for medical fitness - www.simplecarehealth.com with the specific intent of providing members / patients / consumers a differentiated offering focused on the Medical Fitness Difference.  We want to connect fitness, nutrition and health education as part of a coordinated care team for any/all conditions (chronic to general wellness).  I would like to gather your feedback on it if possible at some point.  My colleagues / investors have introduced it to Peter Ng and Anita Watkins at Rex because of personal relationships they have - so I thought I would make you aware.  The real reason for my note - please keep confidential - is that I do not feel I am a fit for the Cleveland Clinic mission/vision and have decided to move my family to the Raleigh market - we have bought a house in Zebulon and are very much looking forward to those Carolina blue skies.  I plan on continuing with H&W Center consulting - partnering with Dr. Tim Stover (former CEO of Akron General) and actively pursuing the SimpleCare software to help define the Medical Fitness Difference nationally as well as a smaller H&W Center concept we are calling Wellness Access Centers.  Again - this is quite confidential - but given that I am coming to Raleigh, I am hoping that we can catch up so that I can learn a bit more about how you see the industry, etc.  My wife and two daughters are always in the Wakefield area and have been in the Wellness Center there - they love it!  So if you have time - I am in town next Friday 10/7 and would like to see if you are available to meet, or hope that we can connect at MFA/Orlando this fall.  I look forward to speaking to you - again please keep confidential.  As you know, this is a rather small industry.  Kind regards, Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m
Please pass along to HR if appropriate. http://www.thinkmattedwards.com

Hi Lori - I hope to talk with you some day at your convenience.    Yesterday, I made the last 8-hour drive south and am officially a North Carolinian! My family has been here since August but I had to finish my time at AGHS.  I am looking to stay in health care and have applied this morning to this position at BCBSNC [Senior Strategic Advisor, Healthcare Strategy].   Just in case, I have included a one page summary of my qualifications and would ask for your consideration of keeping me in mind for any appropriate positions.   Thank you for accepting my request - Michael speaks very highly of you.    Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m

Hi Lori - My name is Matt Edwards. I have been referred to you by my good friend Michael Robinson.  My wife and I decided to move to Raleigh last fall and I have just finished up my time at AGHS.  Would you consider talking to me about my qualifications / my health platform simplecarehealth.com?

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: I am so sorry to hear Matt.  Where do your interests lie for the future?

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: Well... my position was just eliminated.  Officially going to be a free agent in Raleigh, NC.  I hope to stay in touch and see if we can do good together in the future.  Thank you

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: I'm free for the rest of the day.  Call if you can.  Thanks

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: Tomorrow is better but I can do both. Call my mobile when good for you. Number above. Thanks

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: Can you chat tomorrow or Friday?

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: I'm meeting with Shawn Janus of Pacific Medical Buildings at 4:30 pm ET on Thursday - he is in town and interested in talking with me and Dr. Stover. We are also meeting with Don Taylor of Welty Friday AM. FYI  SO... anytime you want to catch up prior to 4:30 that afternoon is open for me.  Pick a time and call me at 330-819-2604   Looking forward to catching up. Matt

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: Matt - Let's set a time to chat.  I would love to catch up with you.  My week is pretty booked, but I do have some time later on Thursday.  How about you?  Patrick

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: Patrick -  Checking in to see how things are going.  Have talked with Dr. Stover about next steps and CBRE always comes up.  Are you aware of anything with H&W Consulting / Fitzroy / Montecito / CBRE?  I would love to talk about potential next steps as I am moving my family to the Raleigh area and need to move forward professionally in 2017.  Please call or reply at your convenience.   330-819-2604 m Thank you - Matt

Patrick - checking in. As you know - many changes here in Akron. Wondering if you have been taking to Doug or Tim?  Based on our conversation in the lobby at the Healthcare Facilities conference last year -  I have some thoughts I want to share for going forward.  Please call me if you can 330-819-2604 m  Thanks - hope all is well (ness)!!

SUBJECT: RE: Agreement Form
CONTENT: Thursday looks good. I do have some time Friday AM  Email me with times and/or content if you want at Matt.Edwards@akrongeneral.org 330-819-2604 m  Thank you,  Sent from LinkedIn for iPhone http://lnkd.in/ios

Hi Matt: It‚Äôs been awhile since we have spoken and I hope that things are continuing to progress well for you personally and professionally.  How is everything at Akron General Partners in your leadership role?  I just was in communication with Denise Mirtich from your EMBA cohort who recently received a very nice promotion at Oswald.    Matt, I would love to have another strong performer from Akron General or from your professional network in our EMBA program.  Can you think of anyone that would be ready for that next move up that could significantly benefit from the BW EMBA program? Even if you have a strong potential candidate outside of Akron General or in a different functional role, a recommendation from you would be important for us.  If you recommend a candidate who matriculates into the BW EMBA program this August, we would provide to that student a $1,000 scholarship in your name.  Additionally, depending upon the credentials of the candidate we would consider him/her for an additional scholarship similar to what you received in the EMBA program. Please let me know if you have any ideas for candidates who could benefit from this program and you believe are the caliber we could consider for a potential scholarship opportunity. Thanks Matt and all the best! Dale  Dale G. Kramer, MBA Director, MBA and Executive MBA Programs School of Business Baldwin Wallace University dkramer@bw.edu 440-826-3331 MBA link - www.bw.edu/mba Open House ‚Äì http://www.bw.edu/graduate-admission/master-of-business-administration/open-houses/index Apply - www.bw.edu/GraduateApplication

Hi Mike - We met through Jake Rohe of Pacific Medical Buildings - would like to keep in touch in case you ever have a H&W need.    I'd like to add you to my professional network on LinkedIn.    - Matt Edwards, MBA

Matt,  Please let me know if there is anything I can do.  You were not in the most envious position and once CC got involved.   I think you know with your skill set that there are great things on your horizon.  -jz

Welp. Was just laid off.  Thanks for all your help - I really appreciate you putting up with me and trying to find a way with the software. Let's stay in touch - you are one of the good guys bud.  Please tell Sarah the same - but she's one of the good gals üòâ  Best wishes Jim.  Matt Edwards edwardsmatt@yahoo.com 330-819-2604 m
Matt. Best going forward. I have appreciated working with you. Do stay in touch. David

Hey Dave - a quick note to let you know I was laid off yesterday and tell you that it was a true pleasure to work with you, representing AGHS and trying to do good every day.  I will miss it.  Best wishes going forward.  I hope to stay in touch.  Matt Edwards edwardsmatt@yahoo.com 330-819-2604 m
Thanks for endorsing me for Patient Safety!
Thank you Matt.

Hey Shannon -  Well... Joe was right.  Wellness was not the place to be.  While I knew that, I couldn't navigate myself out of there in time and was just laid off.  With the writing on the wall...Jennifer and the girls are already in Raleigh, NC and I am going to be joining them next week!  No more snow for my Texas gal.  I am actively looking for my next and would appreciate you keeping me in mind if you know of any opportunity in the Raleigh market.  I hope you left the Clinic on your terms and are doing well at Evive.    Best wishes -  Matt 330-819-2604 m
Whoa!! Big news!! I hope all is well - this sounds exciting for you - congrats! When you have some time - I'd love to connect on what you'll be doing.  Good luck!! Matt 330-819-2604 m

Well... that was fast.  I was just notified yesterday that my position / consultancy has been eliminated!   While a surprise, we had already decided that Akron, Ohio was not going to be home.  I am moving to Raleigh, NC and will be actively pursuing business development / innovations opportunities in health care. As you may recall, I created a consultancy within Cleveland Clinic Akron General selling our IP around health & wellness.  With prevention being considered more than ever, I would like to continue to explore how to leverage existing facilities, building new outpatient models, tying software (I own and created - simplecarehealth.com) and including additional prevention focused care providers to a strategy of how to protect and gain market share with employers and payers for the benefit of the health system brand. Please keep me in mind as you think about the changing landscape and if/how I may be able to add value out of the Raleigh, NC market.   I would relish an opportunity to talk further with you and/or your colleagues about what we have done and what I hope to do.  Thank you for your consideration.   Best wishes,  Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m

Hi Courtney - I hope all is well.  I met you through Jake Rohe at Pacific Medical Buildings.  With all the movement in healthcare - I'd like to stay in touch.  I'd like to add you to my professional network on LinkedIn.    - Matt Edwards, MBA

My apologies - for the "hit enter for send".  Ha  As you will see above, we have met a few times and I am good friends with Blake Squires.   I would like to talk about the software referenced above - but more importantly to me today - I have been laid off from Cleveland Clinic Akron General as they are closing the Health & Wellness Innovations division that I built over five years ago.  I have decided to move to Raleigh, NC and am actively looking for health care related business development opportunities.  I have always been impressed with Explorys and would like ask you to consider if/how my talents might be able to add value to the IBM relationship now that I will be near the RTP. Thank you for your consideration - my apologies again for the multiple notifications today :)  Best wishes, Matt Edwards - now "clicking to send" 330-819-2604 m
Anil -

Hi Anil -   It was nice to run into you yesterday afternoon at the coffee station at CC MIS2016.  I can not believe it has been 18 months at IBM already - congratulations again!  I was hoping to continue initial conversations that were started between Blake Squires (my colleague) and Chuck Lougheed about the SimpleCare platform (spring/summer 2016).  We have created a condition management platform that connects to consumers / patients regardless of acuity to daily activity and a health system based CareTeam.  I would like to further discuss how we can collect daily activity data - and the possibilities that could exist therein.  Please advise on what would be an appropriate manner in which to proceed.  Thank you, Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m

SUBJECT: RE: What could you achieve?
CONTENT: Hi Cindy, thank you for reaching out, but I‚Äôm not interested.

SUBJECT: What could you achieve?
CONTENT: Hi Matt,   I am very impressed by your experience and skill-sets!  I am looking for candidates who have an entrepreneurial mind-set and the passion and desire to have their own business!  I have some fantastic State Farm Agency opportunities in your market area!  If you or someone you know would like to explore further, I would love to schedule a call!   Cindy Coburn, AIC, LTCP, SCLA 304-673-5228 | cindy.coburn.guok@statefarm.com

Hi Lucy - I hope this note finds you well.  BOISE!?!  Good for you!  I love Boise!  I am just keeping in touch as everyone moves around in healthcare these days.  We met with my friends at Mortensen back in 2015 talking about Health & Wellness possibly at Presence.   I am in the process of moving to Raleigh, NC and am working on my next steps...am still at Cleveland Clinic Akron General for now.  I will still be involved in health & wellness but not just buildings.  I have built www.simplecarehealth.com and am looking to use technology to help with everyday lifestyle choices based on where the consumer / patient finds themselves in the continuum.   Best wishes in '17 and beyond - Go Bucks! Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m

Hi Angelene -  I hope this note finds you well. We met at the 2015 Healthcare Design Conference - I spoke about Medical Fitness and technology.  I wanted to see if you had a few minutes to talk about the software I helped develop and gain your insights as to how it could be positioned as health care moves forward.  It is private labeled by design and is intended to wrap care providers to consumers.   www.simplecareheath.com  Please let me know if you have 30 minutes. I'd love to gain your insight as I try to navigate the best use of this platform going forward.   My contact information is above.  Thank you! Matt Edwards

Hi Angelene  Thank you for coming to our talk the other day!  I bought Susan dinner for hogging the microphone. Also thank you for the LinkedIn invite - I would love to hear more about what you are doing and see if there is a way to further improve healthcare together!  (If it helps, I will drink decaf before a meeting with you)  I hope al is well.   Thank you, Matt Edwards  330-819-2604 m Skype: EdwardsMatt
Matt - great to see you this morning and thanks for coming to pick up Tammy.  All the best in Raleigh and look forward to connecting.  Take care, Jay

SUBJECT: RE: I would love to be able to ask your help on an executive search I am working on.
CONTENT: David, thanks for reaching out! I‚Äôd love to hear more about this after recently moving my family to the Raleigh market and looking for the next step in my career as we speak.  I just ramped up in January so the timing is perfect!  Thank you Matt

SUBJECT: I would love to be able to ask your help on an executive search I am working on.
CONTENT: Dear Matt,   I hope all is going well.  I am helping Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center find a Head of Partnerships and Affiliations to be accountable for driving profitable growth through Acquisitions and Joint Ventures. I would love to discuss this opportunity with you and also to hear how you are doing.  You may be able to help lead me to the very best person for this position.  Thank you for your time and I look forward to speaking with you.  Sincerely,  David Stern David Stern Senior Vice President Wakefield Talabisco International 11 East 44th Street, 12th Floor New York, NY 10017 212-661-8600 - Office 212-249-0460 - Home www.wtali.com   David Stern david@wtali.com
You have a lot of fires burning my friend! But at least that pesky MBA is done. Has to feel great!

HI assume all is well.    I am aware that this place has been gutted.  I have no one to talk to there anymore - my investors are thrilled :(     Still GRINDING on this damn software - thank god I was bald before this all started.  I still think I can generate revenue in healthcare if they would just let me try it dammit!      I'm back in OH rounding out my time at Akron General - moved to Raleigh to start a new life there.  Seeing if I can stand up my H&W Buildings consultancy / sell software.  The timing has been tough - as these clients don't seem to be in a hurry to get started.   SOOOO... may be starting a search - which is painful as you know.  All is well though - 11 acre horse farm and three happy girls (wife and 2 daughters) ... I've got a beard and am down 25 lbs. ha!  I'm a damn farmer!    Now to get this professional part figured out..  hope all is well for you and your fam in NYC
major bloodbath once they realized there was very little revenue behind what they were doing!
all fired
Everyone is gone - Robin, Warren, Doug, my whole platform team, etc.
Hola Amigo! Great to hear from you. I remain in touch with folks at UA and have had a few conversations, but it's too early to go back.

Hey bud - - hope all is well...  not sure if you saw this or if you would still be interested in UA...  https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/249729939?trkInfo=searchKeywordString%3A%2CsearchLocationString%3A%252C%2B%2Cvertical%3Ajobs%2CpageNum%3A1%2Cposition%3A4%2CMSRPsearchId%3A9d15851b-1bf5-47f9-9e45-4bf2b7629001&refId=9d15851b-1bf5-47f9-9e45-4bf2b7629001&recommendedFlavor=IN_NETWORK&trk=jobs_jserp_job_listing_text

What is up my man!?!?!? I hope all is well in NYC and with fatherhood!  I see you made a jump... would love to hear about it.  Jennifer and I have moved our family to Raleigh, NC - bough 11+ acre horse property and put my daughters in a great school.  Akron was just too lame to raise our kids here.  I am still grinding on the software and looks like will be starting my own consultancy in Jan = H&W centers, software, m&a... in Raleigh.   Let's keep in touch - let me know if I can help you in any way my brutha.  Edwards 330-819-2604 m

Hey Jeff - I hope all is well.  My friend Michael Roetzel started in your parts department a month ago or so... he's a great guy that I hope will be an asset to you all for a long time.  He loves the place already!  Please keep me posted on how things are going - take care and best wishes in 2017!

Jeff-   I hope all is well - I worked with you guys several years ago (approx 5) looking at a few m&a opportunities.  I have a referral for parts department - please let me know if there are any questions.  I think Greg has passed along info.  Thanks  Matt Edwards, MBA  330-819-2604

SUBJECT: Matt Edwards, applicant
CONTENT: Hi Steve, Without being too forward, I wanted to send a note to confirm that I have recently applied for the Assistant VP, Business Development position at Duke Network Services (401197890).  I am hoping that with your experience at Duke, you may be able to assist me in navigating the process so that I have the opportunity to introduce myself to Duke.  As you will see via my profile, I still work in Ohio at the Cleveland Clinic but have already moved my family to Zebulon, NC to a small horse farm.  I have two daughters and a wife that could not be more pleased to be out of the grey skies and cold weather of Ohio but now it is time for me to find a professional home.  I can not think of a better place than Duke for that.  With all of that said, this is important enough for me to take a chance on reaching out to you with the hopes of a conversation with you or your colleagues.  If this is a common approach and is considered unprofessional or is an annoyance for you, please accept my apologies as I have never tried it before.   While my girls could not be happier with our newly found lifestyle... those horses eat a lot!   So I thought I would take a chance.  Thank you for your consideration.  Best wishes in 2017. Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m

SUBJECT: RE: VP of Sales and Business Development Career Opportunity
CONTENT: Thanks for reaching out, but this is not something I am interested in.

SUBJECT: VP of Sales and Business Development Career Opportunity
CONTENT: Hi Matt,  I saw your profile on LinkedIn and am reaching out to see if you might be interested in a VP of Sales and Business Development opportunity with GradSchoolLoans.com in Cleveland.  GradSchoolLoans.com is an organization focused on lowering medical student loan interest rates to make paying them off more affordable.  I am working with the CEO to identify candidates for the role, and your background looks like a great match for this company and opportunity.  Reporting to the CEO, this VP would build and lead the sales and partnership campaigns across multiple healthcare channels, and define and implement the strategic direction of the organization‚Äôs partnership programs.   There is little to no competition in this specific space, so the organization has the opportunity to be a very large player in this landscape, as well as become a nationally known brand in a very short period of time.   Would you like to talk for a few minutes so I can tell you more about the position? If not, would you kindly click the "not interested" button?   Thanks!  Jennifer   Jennifer Osborn, MBA josborn@talentence.com

If you are interested, please email your resume to me at contact@athlonsearch.com today.  Will contact back!  If not interested, please reply anyhow it helps!  Thanks!  I can get your resume to the right person.  Mike - Athlon Search LLC   Michael Tietema, CHRS

Great to be with you last weekend...      I'd like to add you to my professional network on LinkedIn.    - Matt Edwards, MBA

SUBJECT: Senior Sales Executive - Referral - Growing Healthcare Company
CONTENT: Matt,   I hope you don't mind me reaching out, but when I came across your LinkedIn profile I thought I should ask if you know someone that might match this opportunity (Please see below).     ***** If you do not know of anyone, not a problem, but please accept the message and respond with ''not interested" so I know not to message you again. Thank you. *****  I am working on an opportunity within the health and wellness field for an established  and rapidly growing company. They are viewed as a top notch organization with excellent leadership. They are right here in NE Ohio, as well!    Given your experience and background, I felt you may know someone relative to this role.  The company works with health plans and employers to develop strategies, incentives and programs to promote wellness. They have a full suite of solutions including a platform and compliance through a proprietary software they have developed with associated services. They are able to help corporations improve employee population health, reduce cost, track progress and show a return on investment.    Senior Sales Executive Profile -$150-200K Base. Bonus TBD. Plus generous commission plan(Best VP's who report to this person make $400K+). -$50-100K per year on a 3 year deal is a typical contract.  -$1MM+ per year would be considered a large contract.  -National sales with cycles roughly 3 months minimum, typical 9-12 months and could take 1-2 years for large deals.  -50% travel. -Will develop strategy and manage up to 10 sales execs/managers.   Requirements  -Sales team management.  -Solutions/Consultative sales ~ Not Product  -Healthcare knowledge (Employee Benefits, Healthcare, Insurance). -Selling to the C-Suite.  -Strong leadership and Strategic Development    Please let me know if anyone comes to mind that is qualified and would benefit from this opportunity. Thank you very much!    All the Best,  Dave   Dave Marquez 216-503-2313 x 4005 | dmarquez@alliancesearchsolutions.com

SUBJECT: Opportunity to discuss
CONTENT: Dear Matt,   Your name was recommended to me as I am working on a search for SCL Health for a Senior Director, Business Development for Good Samaritan Medical Center, based in Lafayette, CO a suburb of Denver. SCL Health formerly named Sister of Charity of Leavenworth Health System is a nine hospital system in three states.  I would like to discuss this role with you further. What are best days and times that work for you?  Regards, Joann  Joann Sherrer-Fornoff Vice President Summit Talent Group LLC An Innovation Institute Company A FutureSense Partner 5850 Waterloo Road, Suite 140 Columbia, MD  21045 Mobile: 443.452.8855 | Office: 443.325.7300 jsherrer@summittalentgroup.com  www.summittalentgroup.com   Joann Sherrer, SPHR Vice President Summit Talent Group 443-452-8855 | jsherrer@summittalentgroup.com

I know you are quite busy - and hope you have found Helix to be as fulfilling as you had hoped thus far. I am reaching out quickly to determine if there are business development opportunities within Helix.  I need a change and see that there are some Business Development needs.  The software that I have developed (SimpleCare) has been handed off to investors - and is moving forward quite well.  My time in Akron, Ohio is up - and have bought a home in Raleigh, NC.  Based on my experience in healthcare and with the Cleveland Clinic - I feel I am well qualified to lead or assist a charge in business development / account management (Duke / Mayo).  I know our time together was brief - but I hope you found my innovative sprint and approach to be something that could be considered an asset to Helix. I want to be on the ground floor of something amazing and bring my best effort daily to influence positive change for many.  Having recently gone back to earn my MBA and willingness to travel - I am proactively and selectively looking for an amazing opportunity.  This is email #1.  Please let me know if there is any merit to this thought. I hope this was appropriate - I do not intend to abuse our connection.  I hope all is well.  Thank you,  Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m

He can't get to me except to show up!  üò¨üò¨. I have no idea how one even helps him at this point!  Me too...646-298-6631   When are you headin south?  Courtney Ireland and fam are in Chapel Hill.   And both Steve Meckler and my friend from Cinci High school whom you would absolutely love are in Charlotte.  All spread out.   But in case you want people....!
Text me anytime 330-819-2604  Wow!!!!!!!!!! I'll get him to back off. Understand your concerns about me bringing it up.  I'll be careful

he said he's found a "neat little tree" where he reads in his apartment complex.  i don't think it's anyone's job to really do anything...we all have our paths and that's codependent to get involved.  But he's not right at all.  Like to share that he came to visit and I dont suppose you heard how horrible it was nor the subsequent immediate request for no contact.  whatever you guys all think is ok and you have time for.  Hayes, out on that one.   I tried for a minute.

I can't explain.  He seemed to be literally unwell.  Coupled with occasional, albeit brief moments of completely old school MR normal, but the completely normal even felt creepy bc it was filled with underlying rage and total denial.  He chugged three beers back to back mid afternoon.   It took me 7 years of therapy to graduate!  I dont play that any more.  Hence the blocking.  Who says No to someone saying, Glad you are finding your way...our paths don't jive, and I've no interest in being a project for you.  It's not a friendship...he would obsess with anything I said or did.  Buy, read, lookup things for HOURS.  Send me things.  I say I'm singing off, i get ten page letters.  Flowers, gift cards, etc.  Matt, he's blocked everywhere i know he may be and he finds me by googling I guess.  A photo website i was working on, he created a client profile.  Linkedin he found within a day of my signing on.  Etc.  I already had him blocked on instagram, fb, email, phone.  now LI.  Can't block the photo website.  it's just sad.  He said when here that he'd almost just shown up once when i said Please chill. He will scare the crap out of Nina if he does that. He was here for a day and a 1/2.  Brutal.
Yes... a complete wreck.  Was he creepy?
(PS, I think if you say anything about me to MR it will make it worse.  But I think doing an intervention of sorts w him and his parents and other friends may be worthy....before you go!).

Good gravy!   That's perfection.     If easier, I still have same email and use gmail too ...same toriLhayes@gmail. Or this obvi!   I've yet to become too involved w LinkedIn but getting there!      Fb makes me anxious.   But I use it a lot for content curation and articles.     Take care of you and your ladies and your Arc!!
Not as good of a photographer as you - but this is my new front yard! I'll tell MR to leave you alone.  Let's stay in touch - I'm off FB - not a fan of the "look at me" aspect.  Take care!!

Hey!   So nice to hear from you and that's a dream come true update!   Sounds absolutely amazing.   I just asked Michael again the other day if he would please consider moving so we all can.   I've about had it here Matt!   üòÑ.   Congratulations on a fantastic new adventure!    Yes, re Mike.  Let's just sum that all up in that I threw up an entire day he was here from stress and I have him blocked everywhere I can, yet he continues to send me things and search and find me other places.   I made a request to dc any communication politely and solidly and he said No and keeps going.   A VERY lost soul.   It's heartbreaking....he's such a great guy.   I wish he'd get help.   Or more help.   Not me biz!     When are you moving yourself?   Are Jenn and the girls loving it??    Again, really great to hear from you, and especially that you are doing fantastically well!     T.

I hope all is well for you and Nina - you look as lovely as ever! Let me know what you are up to  We are moving to Raleigh, NC - in fact, my wife and girls are already there - bought a 10 acre horse farm for 3 horses, 2 dogs a cat (and a hamster) and I am working on my Plan B - starting my own consulting business Mr. Roetz said he came out to see you - I'm trying to nudge him a bit on the job front.  He seems like a lost soul. Best - Matt

Skyler - I hope all is well and I hope you remember me, Matt Edwards of Akron General (now Cleveland Clinic) and the guy that started the SimpleCare concept.    I have reached out to Kim to see if I can show a demo of our platform - now that we have it finalized and have moved away from "wellness only focus" to a pretty nimble condition management (chronic to general wellness) tool that enables wrapping a CareTeam around a patient/consumer.  Focus is for health care systems to brand this and take to employers / payors for risk reduction / loyalty / differentiation from retail offerings in markets.      I think you all have been focusing more on telemedicine but wanted to see if there was something that may make sense.  We are a one to one / one to many communication platform that is message based - I would like to see if there is a "click" away from FMH and telemedicine.   The real reason for my note is that CC is not for me and I am moving to the Raleigh area (Zebulon to be exact) and am hoping that we can stay in touch as I move forward on selling software / H&W Center consulting business.  Would you have time for a 30 minute demo of the current state of the product? Information only - just trying to stay in touch with Allscripts as we move forward - have been talking to Kim/Jim for almost five years! Yikes!  Anyhow, I hope to stay in touch - and may need some local tips.    Thank you,  Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m
Hey Matt - nice to see your pic!! Hope you're well.  Abby
Sure thing Matt, I am traveling to the office in NC tomorrow but will gladly call you Tuesday morning.

Whew...relief huh?  Do you even know what to do with yourself now?  It's like slamming on the brakes after speeding at 1000 mph.  I had difficulty with the adjustment, although it was much needed relief! My family has returned to normalcy.  My husband couldn't be happier for that.  I think he and my kids might be permanently scarred from the experience. Ha.  The spouses really take the brunt of it.  I'm not surprised at all that the second year was a bumpy ride because that seems to happen every year with Khuri, but disappointed to hear it wasn't as fulfilling as you expected.  We definitely had our share of drama which detracted from the learning.  I did okay with Khuri, but I understand why many have a rough time with him.  I worked for an exec that was a real a**hole, so dealing with Khuri wasn't far from the norm for me.  I wouldn't be shocked if Khuri departs soon.  Every year it seems like more drama than the last.  Your client respond well to the presentation?  Job is good.  Thanks for asking.  After the EMBA I walked into my new role thinking I could blaze a trail and really get the place into tip top shape rather quickly, but the resistance to change is unreal.   I feel well equipped with all the change mgmt teaching from Mike.  He's awesome.   Well, enjoy your day Saturday!  Congrats!  Get to know your family again, I'm sure they'll appreciate having you back full-time :)  (and work will too). And stay in touch.

Hi Leslie!  We are done!!  We just got our grades from Khuri yesterday and had the longest lecture of our lives from him this last Saturday.  His class was a disaster and at least 80% of our class has met with Dale and John about him specifically.  We got an A on our presentation but he manipulated our grades to give us all B+'s in the course.  He just couldn't let us have A-'s.   I got all A's except Tony... of course.  I personally had a tough time with him and wish I would have learned a bit more during this process.  We "walk" this Saturday and are all just getting our lives back.  Loved Peter Rea's Ethics course and appreciate Mike Marinis doing what he could do but Khuri hijacked the second year.  One of our teams got an F in the dry run and he stopped them in the middle of their presentation ... so we had the necessary drama.  Didn't really get the value I was hoping to get after all is said and done.  Everyone was talking about me asking to hear from your husband in the orientation and now we ALL understand what you guys were going through.  I sure hope there are more smiles in your house these days... I am working on getting them back in my house.  What a process!!  How are you?  How is the new(er) job?  Thank you for all of your guidance through this process.
Just checking in to see how it's going.  Presentation has to be any day now, right?

Good to hear from you!  I was just thinking about you guys this week and wondering how it's going.  Reminiscing about the week from hell last year.  This was the week that was really awful trying to pull together the 2nd deliverable for Khuri and we pulled that all nighter in Kamm.   This marked the turning point when the pressure really let up and we could finally breathe a little.  Hopefully you will be at that point too soon!   Wow, redoing the industry paper...that's awful. How is your capstone going?  Will you have time to focus on the industry paper and keep up on the client project?  Nothing really shocks me anymore with Tony.    Leslie

I am in he THICK of it with Khuri!  I submitted a thing of beauty on the industry paper (after taking a day off and pulling a 27 hour marathon to complete it - you weren't kidding!!) -- and he gave me an F. The biggest F he could fit in the email.  I didn't follow the syllabus to perfection he says.  Anyhow - I have to do another one in a different industry !!!  I am plenty old enough I don't need to be scolded for following directions!! It may be the official end of me - the pressure is too much! Thought you would appreciate the update.  Denise got an A+ by the way I think. Hope all is well for you! 78 days and 22 hours...
Yes, noon is good.
Can I bother you around noon today?  Thank you,   Matt

Hi Matt - Hang in there. Give me a call tomorrow or whenever it works best for you and we can chat.  My cell is 330-591-8897.  Feel free to call anytime during the day or evening.  You're right in the thick of it now and it does get easier.  The most difficult period of the second year was November through mid-February.  Khuri doesn't give you the big picture overview.  He feeds you pieces at a time and it can be difficult to see how it will all come together, but it will.  I promise.  It's probably easier to talk through it, so give me a call and I would be more than happy to give you some advice and help you make some sense of the chaos you're experiencing.  Is Khuri having you each do your own industry report?  If so, make sure you're working on it in conjunction with the Capstone deliverables.   Leslie
Hi Matt,

Leslie -  I hope all is well! Congrats on the "not so new now" job.  I sure hope you are enjoying your newly found time to be with family and friends again.  This is completely insane.  My personal note - please keep between us - is that I am looking for some input on your experience and any advice on how the hell to organize all of this madness that has come our way with Khuri.  I really don't know what to make of this whole process and frankly have become very underwhelmed.  IF and only IF -- you are willing to provide some guidance -- it would be greatly appreciated.  At this point, I have no idea what we are actually going to produce and how it will all come together to be reasonable. While I am trying to actually learn here ... not sure the teaching methodology and time commitment are making that as feasible as I hoped.  If you want to be removed from this request and not included in my panic attack - I totally understand - and you can just tell me so.  However, any insight would be much appreciated...  How in the world did you do it?  Thank you,  Matt Edwards 330-819-2604 m edwardsmatt@yahoo.com Skype: EdwardsMatt

SUBJECT: Director of Business Development
CONTENT: Matt,    am following up to a previous message. I Would you be interested in discussing a new opportunity?    I am an Executive Recruiter conducting a retained search for a Director of Business Development who would be part of an impressive Executive Team. Ideal experience includes leading teams that sell on a multi-level basis, has a "consulting" mind set (selling solutions vs. products and across several verticals including Pharma, plastics, life science, and information services to name a few) and has worked in organizations with high growth.    My client, headquartered in NE Ohio is privately held ($100M) and a leading provider of technology-based services focused within a defined market. By integrating science, technology and business expertise, their goal is to add value throughout the life cycle of their client‚Äôs products, utilizing testing, consulting, information and compliance services. The company has doubled in size every 5 years for the last 20 years!    Along with the VP of Business Development, this role will focus on growing the business by coaching/training and collaborating with regional leaders and internal company presidents to grow a team of Business Development Managers and create new ways to gain market share.     The culture of this company is defined by its strong leadership who is excited by new ideas.    If you enjoy working with "data driven" focused people within a fast paced multi-level sales cycle, I can share a position description and welcome a time to have a brief conversation with you at your convenience. Please provide me your email address.    I look forward to hearing from you.    Regards,  Michelle Gyure  Executive Recruiter  Ratliff & Taylor  216-901-4919  mgyure@rtcpi.com

SUBJECT: System Business Development Role
CONTENT: Hello Matt,    Given your professional background, I would appreciate the opportunity to professionally network with you on confidential leads. Our firm has been retained to conduct a search for the Director, Planning & Business Development for Valley Health, a 6-hospital system, headquartered in Winchester, Virginia. www.valleyhealthlink.com    Reporting to the Vice President, Strategic Services, the Director, Planning & Business Development is responsible for identifying, prioritizing, and pursuing business development activity across the Valley Health enterprise in support of the growth of its respective business units, and within the context of the System‚Äôs strategic plan.  The Director will have 2 direct reports:  Coordinator, Community Relations, and Sr. Planning Analyst.    We are searching for a highly-engaged, and visible Director who will conduct and analyze seminal market research, forecast, and prepare models that establish respective cogent business development cases.  The Director will transcend the ‚Äútransactional‚Äù business development function by ensuring that Valley Health physician and executive leadership are fully committed to opportunities under evaluation, and that these opportunities are well aligned with the System‚Äôs overarching strategy plan.The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of healthcare or Health System business development experience, well-developed communication and leadership skills, and embrace a spirit of entrepreneurialism.     Winchester, Virginia is located at the northernmost tip in the Shenandoah Valley region of Virginia and is 75 miles from Washington, DC. Visit http://www.visitwinchesterva.com/    Thank you,  Mary Louise Howe  Partner  Summit Talent Group  www.summittalentgroup.com  410-924-9469

Friends, Colleagues-     My warmest thanks to the many of you who have reached out to me with enthusiasm for my new book "This Is Your Do-Over," and to those of you who have shared it with loved ones, colleagues, and communities in your life.     I am now writing again to ask for your participation:     Please do share your frank thoughts on the book by writing a review on Amazon here: amzn.to/1vk5MiO or on Barnes & Noble here: http://bit.ly/1BTXRZc     Please feel free to share the book with the patients, partners, and people in your world -- everyone has the chance to help create (including yourself and your communities) a new future of health. The nation needs it... and others will thank you (see below a note I received yesterday).     Share the opportunity and start spreading vitality!     Here's to extra energy,   Mike   @DrMikeRoizen       PS. Here's the note I received yesterday with name and other specifics retracted. This is what makes it fun for me--helping others be more of what they want to be:     I thought I should quickly share with you that you had quite the effect on me. When I first met you many years ago, I had just been diagnosed with PCOS. I was struggling to lose weight and battling insulin resistance. I was struggling with infertility for many years and couldn‚Äôt dig my way out. After our first collaboration together I pulled you aside and you gave me some pointers to kick-start me into a healthy lifestyle. I remember feeling so lost but you encouraged me that I could do it. I‚Äôve since lost nearly 100 lbs, had a baby and I‚Äôm training to run my first ¬Ω marathon. I just can‚Äôt thank you enough!! I‚Äôve attached a before and after pic of me and a pic of me with my son. So I can‚Äôt say THANK YOU enough.

Friends, Colleagues-     I am proud to announce the release of my newest book, "This Is Your Do-Over."    Here's the heart of it: anyone can get a health Do-Over--no matter your genetics, your prediliction for marshmallows, or the number of times you've hopped on the health bandwagon and failed.     All it takes is reaching 5 healthy numbers--with your cholesterol, waist size, tobacco intake, blood sugar, and blood pressure--to reduce your risk of disability and death by 80 to 90 percent. That's it.     The science behind "This Is Your Do-Over" started with those behaviors we found common among people who got their Do-Over. Seven elements sustained success: aligning nutrition, exercise, sex, stress, passion, and brain chemistry--and the key step missing in most other programs: partnering with a health buddy.     I invite you to order a copy now (or a couple -- one for you and one for your buddy!):     amzn.to/1vk5MiO     Thank you.   Mike

Pls send me email at ascheiner@clevelandbrowns and I can work on getting your seats relocated next year and maybe even this year - we can probably move some internal tickets  Sent from LinkedIn for iPhone 	  http://lnkd.in/ios

Alec- Sorry to bother you after such a putrid performance with a lot on the line.  I was fortunate enough to meet you at the PNC Corporate event during training camp this year - I had a great time talking with you and am more proud of the Browns than I have been in a long time.  Unfortunately, my club seats - which I spend a lot of money on - have a suite behind them that has transitioned the from Browns Legends Suite  for the last several years to the Horseshoe Casino seats this year.  This suite apparently hosts the visiting teams' largest gamblers week in and week out. EVERY GAME I  now get to deal with the visitors degenerate gamblers for the game. It is as though we sit in the visitors section every week.   I wanted to bring this to your attention as I spend a significant amount of money on these seats week in and week out, only to have a suite full of visitor's fans ruining my game experience every Sunday - yes - even during wins. This has devalued my experience to a point that I felt it was time to send a note about it.  (We won the Saints game as an example and they were ridiculous).  I am not sure what the solution is but allowing a suite full of visiting fans to sit behind our hard-earned seats week in and week out is a problem.  We were heckled endlessly for the last few games and I think this unfortunately a consistent unintended experience for many of us loyal Browns fans that spend a lot of money with you. (suite 312 row 19).  We had decided to wait to reach out to you to make sure this is a consistent pattern - and unfortunately it has turned out to be every game. These people are impacting most of section 312.  Please have anyone call me if needed. Aside from today's result - I am very bothered by the value we are getting compared to other sections.  There has to be a better answer than having the type of people that frequent Horseshoe casino access to a suite - game in and game out.  This enables a few hours of access to heckling loyal Browns season ticket holders.  Many of us will NEVER step foot inside the Horseshoe Casino as a result of this.   I look forward to a better solution - This isn't working.  I have been pleased with most decisions made this season - this is just too close to home and is impacting my hard earned investment.   Please consider these comments - this is a serious issue going forward.  Thank you to you and your staff for everything! Go Browns!   Kind regards,  Matt Edwards  330-819-2604 m  Sent from LinkedIn for iPhone 	  http://lnkd.in/ios

CONTENT: Dear Matt,    My name is Brad McLaughlin.  I work in Human Resources at OhioHealth in Columbus,OH as their Corporate Executive Recruiter. Dear LinkedIn Friends:  Making data-driven decisions is the key to success in today‚Äôs marketplace. Many businesses and organizations collect a lot of data from MANY sources but don‚Äôt always have the time, expertise or resources to thoroughly analyze that data. CMOR has the capabilities and expertise necessary to analyze data quickly and effectively and deliver key findings and recommendations to make those data-driven decisions.  *Save valuable staff time - we have the software and the expertise to quickly and accurately analyze data. Let us crunch the numbers while you concentrate on other things.  *Make your data work for you ‚Äì get the most out of the data you have by looking at relationships and findings that can be found through expert analysis and interpretation.  *Deliverables are based on your needs - Tables & charts, Top-Line findings, Key Findings and Recommendations, Comprehensive report, PowerPoint presentation or a combination. You choose.  *On-going interpretation of the data - If you have a question about the data or report 6 months down the line, we will answer it without an additional consulting charge.  We have open production time with our analysts between October 15th and November 15th. The end of the year and with that the start of 2014 is fast approaching. This is the ideal time to prepare for strategic planning using data you already have collected or finishing up a project that has been sitting on the shelf. Let us help you make those key data-driven decisions through expert analysis of your existing data.   Sincerely,  Amanda abarna@cmoresearch.com   Call me today at 330-564-4211 to get on the schedule!

It has been an interesting ride since those days - moved to my hometown in Akron, Ohio to raise my two young girls (now 7 & 4) - wanted to try smaller town & seasons - and be near my family.   Ended up as a sales/marketing director in the financial planning space - tough market over the last several years.  SO deceived it was time to start my own business.  Partnered with a semi retired guy with 25 plus years doing it - teaching me the ropes. We closed several deals - many focused in the medical arena - for over $70M in closed transactions. Couldn't have been better out of little Akron,OH.   But with the healthcare I could get as a small business, self employment tax, long sales cycles, etc. Decided to go back to a bigger company to more easily provide for my family.  JUST was hired by the hospital system (started Monday) I did many of my deals with - a nice complement as they watched me for many transactions and created a position for me - which finally - since pre-Chip Data has me in a situation where I have a fantastic long term opportunity to build a lifestyle around for my family. CONTENT:
Hi Matt, 


The Duke Advanced Leadership Program in Health Sector (Duke ALPH) is an 8-month multi-modular program for senior health sector professionals who seek to lead and drive transformative change in the industry. Offered by Duke University‚Äôs Fuqua School of Business in collaboration with Duke University School of Medicine, this program is led by renowned faculty from both prestigious schools. 


The program is designed for senior health sector leaders across industries such as health systems, pharmaceuticals and biotech, telemedicine, digital health, health IT, medical devices, diagnostics, health consulting, insurance, policy and regulatory affairs, government health, public health, and life sciences. 


The curriculum includes cutting-edge industry insights focused on topics vital to health sector leadership, leveraging disruptive technologies like AI/ML, driving business growth and innovation, and fostering patient-centered outcomes.

‚úÖ Credentials from a world-renowned business school

Program Details: 

‚úÖ Duration: April 2025 ‚Äì November 2025 

‚úÖ Format: Blended (Live Online + Classroom Sessions) 

‚úÖ Location: Duke University School of Medicine & Duke University Campus (Durham, N.C., USA) 


We are currently accepting applications for the Duke ALPH 2025 cohort. We believe you can benefit significantly from the program and look forward to connecting with you to answer questions and discuss further. 


Regards, 

Duke ALPH Team

In recent years, ABM has emerged as a core strategy for early stage startups and industry leaders alike because it‚Äôs uniquely capable of accelerating revenue growth and driving product adoption. CONVERSATION TITLE: Your CEO Peer Group Invitation from Chief Executive Network
CONTENT:
Hi Matt,

 

If you are like me, at the start of the new year you may be thinking even more about your professional and personal goals. Therefore, I wanted to invite you to Chief Executive Network's (CEN's) CEO 100 Peer Network, a peer group for Presidents & CEOs who run companies with $100 million to $3 billion in revenues. 


CEN, sister company to the distinguished, Chief Executive Magazine, launched The CEO100 in 2021 in order to give CEOs, such as yourself, access to unbiased advice, ideas and support on pressing strategic, organizational, board and personal leadership issues from peers who are or have been in the same situations and learned important lessons they are willing to share.  


Members also get personal, sage guidance from CEO mentors who have run larger corporations and are willing to share their experiences, mistakes and advice with you. 


Based on your profile, this network may be a powerful resource for you. Please let me know if you would like to learn more. I would be happy to send you the agenda for our upcoming meeting and additional information for you to review.

 

I hope to hear from you soon.


Best,

Rob

How are you holding up? In the past year, teachers and admins have been expected to learn a lot on the fly. If we‚Äôve learned anything, it‚Äôs that high-quality digital curricula is a necessity, not a luxury. So how come the market hasn‚Äôt risen up to meet demand?
